page.title: 16INTERESTING PEOPLE:ST.ALBANS
page.content: {BILL HAMILTON.}Today, as Home Affairs Correspondent of B.B.C. T.V. News, I have just visited Holloway Prison in London. This is just one of many jails which are totally overcrowded and holding over 4,800 inmates. From St. Albans, I travel around the country reporting on Law and Order issues, as well as immigration, race relations and a problem which is fast emerging as the scourge of the decade, the number of young people who've sadly become addicted to hard drugs. {P.C. BROWN.}P.C. Brown is a community} police officer for Jersey Farm and Marshalswick. He works 2 shifts from 8a.m. to 4p.m. and from 4p.m. to midnight. He has a variety of duties including visiting homes, schools and the shopping areas to talk to people to see if they have any problems. He has also trained police dogs.
